title: How to Make Custard
description:
Learn How to Make Custard with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Custard

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to make custard start by heating one in three-quarter cups or 415 milliliters of milk in a saucepan over low heat bring the milk to a simmer then remove it from the heat in a separate bowl beat four egg yolks until smooth add in 1/3 cup or 66 grams of raw sugar and continue to beat the mixture and the mixture has thickened and is a pale yellow color start to pour in the milk very slowly while beating the mixture continue to add the milk slowly until it's all mixed in beating the mixture until it's smooth now transfer the custard to a saucepan on low heat stir continuously until the custard thickens and do not allow it to simmer then remove the custard from the heat and whisk it until it cools finally pour the custard through a sieve and stir in 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract serve and enjoyto make custard start by heating one in three-quarter cups or 415 milliliters of milk in a saucepan over low heat bring the milk to a simmer then remove it from the heat in a separate bowl beat four egg yolks until smooth add in 1/3 cup or 66 grams of raw sugar and continue to beat the mixture and the mixture has thickened and is a pale yellow color start to pour in the milk very slowly while beating the mixture continue to add the milk slowly until it's all mixed in beating the mixture until it's smooth now transfer the custard to a saucepan on low heat stir continuously until the custard thickens and do not allow it to simmer then remove the custard from the heat and whisk it until it cools finally pour the custard through a sieve and stir in 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract serve and enjoy

subtitles: to make dried fruits start by cutting some fruit into thin slices if you're drying small fruits like berries you can leave them whole then spread the fruit out on a lined baking sheet and put it in the oven let the fruit dry for four 4-8 hours at your oven's lowest temperature setting once the fruit is finished drying take it out of the oven and serve or store for laterto make dried fruits start by cutting some fruit into thin slices if you're drying small fruits like berries you can leave them whole then spread the fruit out on a lined baking sheet and put it in the oven let the fruit dry for four 4-8 hours at your oven's lowest temperature setting once the fruit is finished drying take it out of the oven and serve or store for later

title: How to Make Eggs in a Basket
description:
Learn how to make eggs in a basket with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Eggs-in-a-Basket

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to make eggs in a basket make a two inch hole in the center of a bread slice by pressing the mouth of a glass or jar into the bread or cut out the hole with a knife you can use white wheat sourdough or any other bread you like butter both sides then fry the bread in hot butter in a skillet until both sides are browned add a little more butter in the hole then crack an egg and drop it in fry the egg for one to two minutes then flip the bread to fry the other side enjoy your eggs in a basket with a fork or eat it like a piece of toastto make eggs in a basket make a two inch hole in the center of a bread slice by pressing the mouth of a glass or jar into the bread or cut out the hole with a knife you can use white wheat sourdough or any other bread you like butter both sides then fry the bread in hot butter in a skillet until both sides are browned add a little more butter in the hole then crack an egg and drop it in fry the egg for one to two minutes then flip the bread to fry the other side enjoy your eggs in a basket with a fork or eat it like a piece of toast

title: How to Make French Toast
description:
Learn How to Make French Toast with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-French-Toast

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to make french toast first gather your materials to make about a dozen slices combine 6 eggs 3/4 cup 175 milliliters of milk 1 tsp vanilla extract and a bit of cinnamon in a bowl beat the ingredients with a fork or whisk once the ingredients are thoroughly mixed dip a slice of bread into the bowl and let it soak for up to 20 minutes during this time heat a few tablespoons of butter in a pan over medium-high heat once the butter starts to sizzle turn the temperature down to medium-low cook each side of bread for forty-five seconds then serveto make french toast first gather your materials to make about a dozen slices combine 6 eggs 3/4 cup 175 milliliters of milk 1 tsp vanilla extract and a bit of cinnamon in a bowl beat the ingredients with a fork or whisk once the ingredients are thoroughly mixed dip a slice of bread into the bowl and let it soak for up to 20 minutes during this time heat a few tablespoons of butter in a pan over medium-high heat once the butter starts to sizzle turn the temperature down to medium-low cook each side of bread for forty-five seconds then serve

title: How to Make Giblet Gravy
description:
Learn How to Make Giblet Gravy with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Giblet-Gravy

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to make giblet gravy start by pouring the drippings from the roasting pan the turkey was cooked in into a bowl then wait 15 minutes for the drippings and fat to separate once you see the clear fat at the top skim it off and set it aside for later place the roasting pan across to burners set to medium-low and pour some of the fat into it the more fat you use the richer your giblet gravy will be after you add the fat with skin half a cup 64 grams of flour until it Browns which should take around 10 minutes then pour in four cups 946 milliliters of sodium free broth followed by half of the drippings continue to cook and whisk the gravy for about five minutes or until it thickens finally add chopped giblets and neck meat to the pan and season with a bit of salt and pepperto make giblet gravy start by pouring the drippings from the roasting pan the turkey was cooked in into a bowl then wait 15 minutes for the drippings and fat to separate once you see the clear fat at the top skim it off and set it aside for later place the roasting pan across to burners set to medium-low and pour some of the fat into it the more fat you use the richer your giblet gravy will be after you add the fat with skin half a cup 64 grams of flour until it Browns which should take around 10 minutes then pour in four cups 946 milliliters of sodium free broth followed by half of the drippings continue to cook and whisk the gravy for about five minutes or until it thickens finally add chopped giblets and neck meat to the pan and season with a bit of salt and pepper

title: How to Make Greek Yoghurt
description:
Learn how to make greek yoghurt with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Greek-Yoghurt

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/wikihow/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@wikihow
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
subtitles: to make greek yogurt first heat one quart 950 milliliters of pasteurized milk over medium-low heat stick a food thermometer into the milk every three to five minutes to monitor the temperature once the milk is heated to 160 degrees fahrenheit 71 degrees celsius turn the heat off and wait for the temperature to drop to 110 degrees fahrenheit 43 degrees celsius then add one packet of yogurt starter if you'd prefer you can also use three tablespoons 46 grams of live yogurt stir the milk and yogurt together for one minute next pour the mixture into a glass container and put on an airtight oven safe lid place the glass container in the oven and set the oven to 110 degrees fahrenheit 43 degrees celsius if your oven doesn't go this low set the glass out in the warm sun or turn the light on in your oven and leave the glass container next to it let the milk incubate for 5 to 12 hours until the yogurt has thickened and set then remove the glass container from the oven and strain it into a new container using a tea towel or cheesecloth this will remove the whey and turn your regular yogurt into greek yogurt pour the yogurt from your cheesecloth or towel into a new container and put the lid on set the container in your refrigerator for two hours before serving or eating your yogurt to store your greek yogurt leave it in the refrigerator with the lid on your homemade yogurt will last roughly 2 weeks you can make a new batch of yogurt by repeating this process with 3 tablespoons 46 grams of your initial batch before it goes badto make greek yogurt first heat one quart 950 milliliters of pasteurized milk over medium-low heat stick a food thermometer into the milk every three to five minutes to monitor the temperature once the milk is heated to 160 degrees fahrenheit 71 degrees celsius turn the heat off and wait for the temperature to drop to 110 degrees fahrenheit 43 degrees celsius then add one packet of yogurt starter if you'd prefer you can also use three tablespoons 46 grams of live yogurt stir the milk and yogurt together for one minute next pour the mixture into a glass container and put on an airtight oven safe lid place the glass container in the oven and set the oven to 110 degrees fahrenheit 43 degrees celsius if your oven doesn't go this low set the glass out in the warm sun or turn the light on in your oven and leave the glass container next to it let the milk incubate for 5 to 12 hours until the yogurt has thickened and set then remove the glass container from the oven and strain it into a new container using a tea towel or cheesecloth this will remove the whey and turn your regular yogurt into greek yogurt pour the yogurt from your cheesecloth or towel into a new container and put the lid on set the container in your refrigerator for two hours before serving or eating your yogurt to store your greek yogurt leave it in the refrigerator with the lid on your homemade yogurt will last roughly 2 weeks you can make a new batch of yogurt by repeating this process with 3 tablespoons 46 grams of your initial batch before it goes bad to make greek yogurt first heat one quart 950 milliliters of pasteurized milk over medium-low heat stick a food thermometer into the milk every three to five minutes to monitor the temperature once the milk is heated to 160 degrees fahrenheit 71 degrees celsius turn the heat off and wait for the temperature to drop to 110 degrees fahrenheit 43 degrees celsius then add one packet of yogurt starter if you'd prefer you can also use three tablespoons 46 grams of live yogurt stir the milk and yogurt together for one minute next pour the mixture into a glass container and put on an airtight oven safe lid place the glass container in the oven and set the oven to 110 degrees fahrenheit 43 degrees celsius if your oven doesn't go this low set the glass out in the warm sun or turn the light on in your oven and leave the glass container next to it let the milk incubate for 5 to 12 hours until the yogurt has thickened and set then remove the glass container from the oven and strain it into a new container using a tea towel or cheesecloth this will remove the whey and turn your regular yogurt into greek yogurt pour the yogurt from your cheesecloth or towel into a new container and put the lid on set the container in your refrigerator for two hours before serving or eating your yogurt to store your greek yogurt leave it in the refrigerator with the lid on your homemade yogurt will last roughly 2 weeks you can make a new batch of yogurt by repeating this process with 3 tablespoons 46 grams of your initial batch before it goes bad

title: How to Make Guacamole
description:
Learn How to Make Guacamole with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Guacamole

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to make guacamole first gather your materials you'll need four ripe avocados a white onion cilantro a lime and some salt you can also include jalapeno for spice and tomatoes for extra flavor to start cut four ripe avocados in half and remove the pits then scoop the avocado into a bowl with a spoon and mash it with a fork until there are only small chunks left next add 1/2 cup or 70 grams of chopped white onion 1/4 cup or 15 grams of chopped cilantro and 3 tablespoons or 45 milliliters of lime juice season the guacamole with 1 teaspoon or 5 grams of salt and stir everything together for spicier guacamole remove the seeds and ribs from one jalapeno and chop the jalapeno into small pieces add the jalapeno to the guacamole and stir finally for extra flavor you can also chop 1 to 2 ripe tomatoes and stir them in with the other ingredients add more salt as needed to give the guacamole more flavor and enjoyto make guacamole first gather your materials you'll need four ripe avocados a white onion cilantro a lime and some salt you can also include jalapeno for spice and tomatoes for extra flavor to start cut four ripe avocados in half and remove the pits then scoop the avocado into a bowl with a spoon and mash it with a fork until there are only small chunks left next add 1/2 cup or 70 grams of chopped white onion 1/4 cup or 15 grams of chopped cilantro and 3 tablespoons or 45 milliliters of lime juice season the guacamole with 1 teaspoon or 5 grams of salt and stir everything together for spicier guacamole remove the seeds and ribs from one jalapeno and chop the jalapeno into small pieces add the jalapeno to the guacamole and stir finally for extra flavor you can also chop 1 to 2 ripe tomatoes and stir them in with the other ingredients add more salt as needed to give the guacamole more flavor and enjoy
